About.Name: Aryan Bataan
About.AboutText:
Hi, I am Aryan Bataan. I am a passionate computer science student with a keen interest in software development and programming. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills in various areas of computer science, with a particular focus on C++ programming.

I enjoy tackling challenging programming projects and I thrive in collaborative environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers.

Beyond the classroom, I actively engage in extracurricular activities related to computer science, including hackathons, coding competitions, and open-source contributions. I believe in the importance of continuous learning and seek out opportunities to explore new technologies and methodologies.

Experience.ExperienceText: I'm currently a computer science student
Experience.EmploymentText: During my time at Boeing, I was tasked with re-imaging laptops and desktops to ensure they were configured correctly for end-users. This involved preparing systems with the latest operating systems and required software, tailored to specific departmental needs. Alongside this, I managed computer refresh equipment swaps, where outdated hardware was replaced with new, optimized devices. These swaps were seamless transitions for users, ensuring minimal disruption to their workflow.
Skills: Python, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, C++, React Native, C#, Java, C, Prolog, Go, NodeJS
Experience.SkillsText: My programming experience spans a diverse range of languages, each contributing to my growth as a developer. Python has been a cornerstone for data analysis, machine learning, and automation, allowing me to solve complex problems with simplicity and efficiency. JavaScript and NodeJS are central to my expertise in web development, enabling me to build dynamic interfaces and scalable back-end systems. While HTML/CSS provide the structural foundation for web applications, React Native extends my capabilities to create cross-platform mobile solutions. I’ve tackled high-performance challenges with C++ and explored memory management and system-level programming with C, while Java and C# have equipped me to develop scalable enterprise and Android applications. Go has been invaluable for its concurrency features, especially in building modern, efficient systems, and Prolog offered insights into logical programming and AI problem-solving. Each language is a unique tool I’ve honed to adapt to the challenges of software development.

Project1.Title: System Proposal
Project1.Desc:
CSC3150's First Project.

The project is a system proposal for Yesteryear, an immersive cinematic experience application for the Apple Vision Pro headset. It includes sections on the project's vision, feasibility assessment, functional and non-functional requirements, use-case models, and system evolution to ensure a comprehensive and engaging user experience.

Project2.Title: System Specification
Project2.Desc:
CSC3150's Final Project.

The project is a system specification for Yesteryear, an immersive cinematic application for the Apple Vision Pro headset. It details the system's evolution, structural model, architectural design, user interface requirements, and security measures, aiming to deliver a premium theatre-like experience at home.
